title: Read the CBS Report Bari Weiss Doesn‚Äôt Want You to See
description: The...
fullText:
In this time of unrelenting, often unprecedented cruelty and lawlessness, I‚Äôm grateful for Nation readers like you.

So many of you have taken to the streets, organized in your neighborhood and with your union, and showed up at the ballot box to vote for progressive candidates. You‚Äôre proving that it is possible‚Äîto paraphrase the legendary Patti Smith‚Äîto redeem the work of the fools running our government.

And as we head into 2026, I promise that The Nation will fight like never before for justice, humanity, and dignity in these United States.

At a time when most news organizations are either cutting budgets or cozying up to Trump by bringing in right-wing propagandists, The Nation‚Äôs writers, editors, copy editors, fact-checkers, and illustrators confront head-on the administration‚Äôs deadly abuses of power, blatant corruption, and deconstruction of both government and civil society.

We couldn‚Äôt do this crucial work without you.

Through the end of the year, a generous donor is matching all donations to The Nation‚Äôs independent journalism up to $75,000. But the end of the year is now only days away.

Time is running out to have your gift doubled. Don‚Äôt wait‚Äîdonate now to ensure that our newsroom has the full $150,000 to start the new year.

Another world really is possible. Together, we can and will win it!

title: The Christmas Narrative Is About Charity and Love, Not Greed and Self-Dealing
description: John...
fullText:
John Fugelsang and Pope Leo XIV remind us that Christian nationalism and capitalism get in the way of the message of the season.

As John Fugelsang, who runs the risk of becoming this era‚Äôs ablest political commentator, reminds us, ‚ÄúThe Christmas economy depends on people buying possessions to celebrate the birthday of the man who renounced possessions.‚Äù

The author of this year‚Äôs best-selling objection to the abuses of religion and politics by right-wing Christian nationalists, Separation of Church and Hate: A Sane Person‚Äôs Guide to Taking Back the Bible from Fundamentalists, Fascists, and Flock-Fleecing Frauds, Fugelsang is a decent and good-humored fellow who has no desire to snow on our Christmas fun. He simply wants to remind us of biblical entreaties that tend to be lost on right-wing zealots who claim‚Äîas President Donald Trump has‚Äîthat ‚ÄúChristianity is under tremendous siege‚Äù by liberal do-gooders.

‚ÄúJesus consistently sided with the underdogs, not the privileged and powerful,‚Äù writes Fugelsang. ‚ÄúBroad-minded, tolerant, and way too inclusive for the ultraconservatives of his day, the Nazarene modeled generosity and selflessness, and told his followers to share their resources and prioritize the well-being of other people over personal gain.‚Äù

Jesus stood up to‚Ä¶the authoritarians among then religious leaders, drunk on their own eminence.

The wealthy, worshiping their own stature and possessions while denying the suffering of the poor.

The capitalists in the temple, greedily exploiting poor believers.

The imperial government of Rome, whose hunger for power led to its own collapse.

Those who imagine that this is too militant an interpretation of the gospels might consider the Gospel of Matthew, with its charge: ‚ÄúFor I was an hungred, and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty and ye gave me drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me in:‚Äù

Or they might turn to the messages of Pope Leo XIV, who has carried forward the work of his predecessor Pope Francis, by asserting the importance of the Catholic Church‚Äôs ‚Äúpreferential option for the poor.‚Äù Leo wrote in his first apostolic exhortation, ‚ÄúGod has a special place in his heart for those who are discriminated against and oppressed, and he asks us, his church, to make a decisive and radical choice in favor of the weakest.‚Äù

The bluntness with which the new pope has challenged the excesses of capitalism has drawn global comment‚Äînot all of it favorable. The pope has argued:

A concrete commitment to the poor must also be accompanied by a change in mentality that can have an impact at the cultural level. In fact, the illusion of happiness derived from a comfortable life pushes many people towards a vision of life centered on the accumulation of wealth and social success at all costs, even at the expense of others and by taking advantage of unjust social ideals and political-economic systems that favor the strongest. Thus, in a world where the poor are increasingly numerous, we paradoxically see the growth of a wealthy elite, living in a bubble of comfort and luxury, almost in another world compared to ordinary people. This means that a culture still persists‚Äîsometimes well disguised‚Äîthat discards others without even realizing it and tolerates with indifference that millions of people die of hunger or survive in conditions unfit for human beings.

In September, Leo issued an exhortation to Christians on love for the poor. The document builds upon the writings of Francis, who died in April 2025 at age 88 and who also decried the excesses of capitalism with references to how ‚Äúthis economy kills.‚Äù

That is bold language, but it is also an honest assessment, as was Francis‚Äôs 2024 notation: ‚ÄúIt is often precisely the wealthiest who oppose the realization of social justice or integral ecology out of sheer greed.‚Äù

In this season of light and charity, we have every reason to hope for the renewal of those instincts that Abraham Lincoln identified as ‚Äúthe better angels of our nature.‚Äù To do so, we must recognize the urgency of Pope Francis‚Äôs warning that ‚Äúas long as the problems of the poor are not radically resolved by rejecting the absolute autonomy of markets and financial speculation and by attacking the structural causes of inequality, no solution will be found for the world‚Äôs problems or, for that matter, to any problems.‚Äù When he repeated this observation shortly before his passing, Francis observed, ‚ÄúI know it bothers [people when I say that], but it is the truth.‚Äù

In this time of unrelenting, often unprecedented cruelty and lawlessness, I‚Äôm grateful for Nation readers like you.

So many of you have taken to the streets, organized in your neighborhood and with your union, and showed up at the ballot box to vote for progressive candidates. You‚Äôre proving that it is possible‚Äîto paraphrase the legendary Patti Smith‚Äîto redeem the work of the fools running our government.

And as we head into 2026, I promise that The Nation will fight like never before for justice, humanity, and dignity in these United States.

At a time when most news organizations are either cutting budgets or cozying up to Trump by bringing in right-wing propagandists, The Nation‚Äôs writers, editors, copy editors, fact-checkers, and illustrators confront head-on the administration‚Äôs deadly abuses of power, blatant corruption, and deconstruction of both government and civil society.

We couldn‚Äôt do this crucial work without you.

Through the end of the year, a generous donor is matching all donations to The Nation‚Äôs independent journalism up to $75,000. But the end of the year is now only days away.

Time is running out to have your gift doubled. Don‚Äôt wait‚Äîdonate now to ensure that our newsroom has the full $150,000 to start the new year.

Another world really is possible. Together, we can and will win it!

title: Revealed ‚Äì Inter Milan ‚ÄòSketched Out‚Äô ‚Ç¨60M Plan To Sign Atalanta Midfielder Last Summer
description: Inter Milan reportedly ‚Äòsketched out‚Äô a detailed plan to sign Atalanta midfielder Ederson last summer.According to Corriere di Bergamo via FCInter1908, the Brazilian was Inter‚Äôs top target ahead...
fullText:
Inter Milan reportedly ‚Äòsketched out‚Äô a detailed plan to sign Atalanta midfielder Ederson last summer.

According to Corriere di Bergamo via FCInter1908, the Brazilian was Inter‚Äôs top target ahead of Ademola Lookman.

Despite spending most of the summer trying to land the Nigerian winger, the Nerazzurri eventually ended up empty-handed.

Indeed, Atalanta fended off Inter‚Äôs repeated attempts to close the deal, even banishing the former RB Leipzig ace from the squad.

However, Lookman was not Inter‚Äôs priority.

BERGAMO, ITALY ‚Äì SEPTEMBER 15: √âderson of Atalanta BC and Amir Richardson of ACF Fiorentina in action during the Serie A match between Atalanta and Fiorentina at Gewiss Stadium on September 15, 2024 in Bergamo, Italy. (Photo by Francesco Scaccianoce/Getty Images)

Before going ‚Äòall-out‚Äô in their pursuit of Lookman, Inter had hoped to lure Ederson away from Bergamo.

With Hakan Calhanoglu heavily linked with a move to Istanbul, the Nerazzurri had identified Ederson as his replacement.

Furthermore, Cristian Chivu‚Äôs men were reportedly willing to offer around ‚Ç¨60 million to land the 26-year-old.

Yet, like in Lookman‚Äôs case, Atalanta had no interest in selling their first-team stalwart under any circumstances.

La Dea‚Äôs stance might change, especially considering Ederson‚Äôs contract runs out in the summer of 2027.

title: St Louis Cardinals Christmas Eve Open Thread and Farewell to Willson
description: Willson Contreras You were a Cardinal Great Bat Tape Chewer I will always remember Willson Contreras fondly as a Cardinal. He was a total pro when it comes to putting up with the Cardinals organizational moves and their handling of his catching and subsequent move to first base. Which he excelled at. His personality was [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
I will always remember Willson Contreras fondly as a Cardinal. He was a total pro when it comes to putting up with the Cardinals organizational moves and their handling of his catching and subsequent move to first base. Which he excelled at. His personality was too much for some fans, but he was a true competitor and team leader in his own way. Sure he was slightly unpredictable and lost too much to e due to injuries, but that is part of the downside of his ferocious style of baseball. I think most fans will miss his spirit and competitiveness, which also made watching baseball more entertaining if you are into ridiculous baseball players.

He was, in my opinion, classy about it. He wasn‚Äôt as mean spirited as many characters that have played hardball throughout the ages, but he certainly rubbed some people the wrong way. When I watched however, it made me glad he was able to have his own style of play. And he was actually really good, once you got down to it.

He was never as bad of a defensive catcher as portrayed, and he was rather offensive at the plate, hacking away and trying to get a hit. And he could hit the ball hard.

His 2024 season will make some of us wonder what would‚Äôve been if he didn‚Äôt miss nearly half the season and if he was surrounded by a little better team. It was probably his peak season if you extrapolate out to 29 home runs and the highest wOBA and wRC+ of his career including his time with the Cubs. If he tops that we will miss him even more.

Willson converted himself to one of the best first basemen in MLB last year: 11th best in fWAR and wRC+ (tied with Alec Burleson at 124!). When bragging about his defense after he made the conversion, he was bettered by only Matt Olson and Lenny Sosa in 2025 according to fangraphs. So by switching to Burly, we probably aren‚Äôt going to miss much hitting-wise, but our defense will worsen somewhat‚Ä¶ To what extent it‚Äôll be noticeable at first base we will have to wait and see.

On offense one big difference will probably be that Burly won‚Äôt strike out nearly as much as Willson. It is quite possible Burleson will have a better year at the plate than Contreras. And maybe most importantly, one of Burleson or Contreras had to be traded in this rebuild phase. This prevents Alec Burleson the outfielder from happening for the most part.

The bat tape chewing incident and the box of candy throwing fit will be entertaining memories of the competitive and sometimes dominant at bats by Contreras. He will be remembered fondly by many Cardinals fans, and I wish him well even if it‚Äôs the Red Sox he‚Äôs playing for now. Willson is an asset to any team, a true team player and competitor.

I am turning 50 today and am meeting up with a few friends and family, Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays to all you reading out there. Please talk amongst yrselves you elves and reindeer and other characters ü¶åüéÑ

title: Habs Daily: Hutson Excels, Fowler Confidence, Koivu
description: Here are the Montreal Canadiens news items, stories, and content you may have missed on Tuesday. Montreal Canadiens News Make [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Here are the Montreal Canadiens news items, stories, and content you may have missed on Tuesday.

Make sure you don‚Äôt miss any Canadiens news by signing up to our weekly newsletter! You can also [Sportsnaut]

Jacob Fowler once again instilled an impressive level of confidence throughout the lineup, helping the Habs turn the tables on the Boston Bruins, and earning a well-deserved 6-2 win. Fowler now has a .918 save percentage, which is incredible when we consider his lack of professional experience. Beyond Fowler, the Habs received important contributions from their best players, which is always a good recipe for a win. [Canadiens Highlights: Fights And Goals Galore]

We‚Äôre used to Lane Hutson providing dominant efforts for the Habs, but he‚Äôs somehow managed to find a new gear in December. Statistically speaking, Thursday night‚Äôs game versus the Bruins wasn‚Äôt just a great showing by Hutson, it was the best game of the year from any Habs player. Interestingly, Hutson has registered the highest game score of any player this season, and he also holds the second, third, and fourth spot on the list.

well this is certainly a statement pic.twitter.com/HPEbRqrhC2

‚Äî HockeyStatCards (@hockeystatcards) December 24, 2025

Here‚Äôs what the game scores looked like for the entire team. Sometimes, the eye test and the numbers don‚Äôt line up, but on Thursday night they definitely did when it comes to Hutson‚Äôs play.

NHL GameScore Impact Card for Montreal Canadiens on 2025-12-23: pic.twitter.com/EWbMfhfanx

‚Äî HockeyStatCards (@hockeystatcards) December 24, 2025

Aatos Koivu served as Finland‚Äôs second-line right wing as they took on Team USA in a World Juniors Championship pre-tournament game. The Americans won 3-1, but it should be noted that Koivu assisted on Finland‚Äôs only goal of the game.

Finland gets on the board first with Heikki Ruohonen tipping in Aatos Koivu's shot.

1-0. #WorldJuniors pic.twitter.com/LDsMi3YGfR

‚Äî Steven Ellis (@SEllisHockey) December 24, 2025

The preceding game was not suitable for all audiences. As the Toronto Maple Leafs moved the Tuesday start time to 4 p.m. against the Pittsburgh Penguins to hold a Next Gen kids‚Äô game, many of the mistakes should have been witnessed by impressionable children who might themselves play hockey. [Pittsburgh Penguins]

Jacob Markstrom wasn‚Äôt just the best player for the New Jersey Devils (20-16-1) on Tuesday night, but he was the best player on the ice for both teams. He flashed leather, made significant pad saves, and fought his way through traffic. He was downright terrific, and showed the Devils brass the goaltender they hoped for when they signed him to a new two-year extension. Until he didn‚Äôt. [New Jersey Devils]

There have been a lot of factors behind the Toronto Maple Leafs‚Äò dreadful season thus far. One of the most putrid facets of the team has been its NHL-worst power play. And with that, the Leafs have made their first major move to try to change their fortunes by firing assistant coach Marc Savard. The power play was his responsibility. [Toronto Maple Leafs]

title: A new betting favorite has emerged for Michigan Football‚Äôs next HC
description: More than two weeks following the firing of Sherrone Moore, there is a new betting favorite to be Michigan‚Äôs next head football coach:
fullText:
It‚Äôs been more than two weeks since the firing of Sherrone Moore, and a lot has changed in Michigan‚Äô search for its new head football coach since then. Kalen DeBoer and Kenny Dillingham were the top guys at the beginning of the search, but both those guys are now seemingly out with Alabama winning its first-round game in the College Football Playoff last Friday and Dillingham signing a new deal with Arizona State last Saturday.

A lot of the recent reports have been focused on Louisville head coach Jeff Brohm, and that is now being reflected in the Vegas betting odds.

According to BetOnline, the new betting favorite to be the next head coach of the Wolverines is Brohm (+150). Michigan interim head coach Biff Poggi (+300) and former Utah head coach Kyle Whittingham (+300) are right on Brohm‚Äôs heels, as is Washington head coach Jedd Fisch (+500) despite there being no buzz for him lately. Interestingly enough, DeBoer is still listed here with +900 odds.

The last time we checked on these betting odds, Dillingham was the favorite with -150 odds, while Brohm was a major long shot with +3,300 odds. Poggi was also a long shot with +2,000 odds, but has made a major move up the list on BetOnline.

As is the case with any head coaching search, things are changing by the moment. What‚Äôs true today may not be true tomorrow, and that is most certainly the case here. While nobody truly knows who Michigan‚Äôs next head football coach will be until we get official word from the athletic department, there is no denying that Brohm‚Äôs name is picking up steam here and is the one to watch as we head into the Christmas holiday.

Who do you want to be Michigan‚Äôs next head coach? Any of these options? Someone else? Let us know down in the comments section below.

title: Wednesday Bird Droppings: Former O‚Äôs on the move
description: On this Christmas Eve, Orioles fans can appreciate just how active their team has been this offseason.
fullText:
A quiet period in MLB may be approaching. Baseball players, agents, and executives are people, and they also like to spend time with family around the holidays. With today being Christmas Eve, that could mean relatively few moves of significance in the next couple of days.

But that‚Äôs OK! The Orioles have been the busiest team in baseball so far this offseason. They are far better now than they were at the end of the 2025 season, and their aggressiveness so far leads me to believe they will act to shore up the couple of holes left of the roster before spring training arrives. I can let them have a few days to chill.

If I were to write up a last-minute Christmas wish list of players I want to the Orioles to add, it would be pretty short at this point. Jolly old Saint Mike Elias has been cooking. But there are still some things I‚Äôve got my eye on.

In the rotation, I want one more arm, but not just any arm. The unit needs a proven veteran that you ‚Äúknow‚Äù is going to give you quality innings. While I like the the trio of Kyle Bradish, Trevor Rogers, and Shane Baz, we have to admit they come with some unknowns and significant risk. And if I‚Äôm honest, the free agent options just don‚Äôt seem like a fit unless one of them goes for the short-term, high AAV deal that Elias is probably angling for. In my dreams, I want Tarik Skubal. More realistically, I‚Äôm good with Freddy Peralta.

My other desires are less specific. This team needs another veteran bullpen arm, preferably a lefty. I‚Äôm not picky. Just grab anything that looks like decent quality at a reasonable price. The same goes for a utility infield option. The one I have (Jeremiah Jackson) doesn‚Äôt fit just right. I need someone with a glove I can count on, especially on the middle infield. It shouldn‚Äôt cost too much.

What I really want, I can‚Äôt even ask for. It‚Äôs just too much. But if you poke me enough, I suppose I will relent. Give me a Gunnar Henderson extension. I know. I know. It‚Äôs not happening. They are impossible to find and extremely expensive. But sometimes it‚Äôs fun to dream. So I will put it out into the universe just in case.

Honestly, I won‚Äôt be greedy this holiday season. My team is making an effort. They are trying to win in 2026. That‚Äôs just about all I could reasonably ask for.

Pirates To Sign Ryan O‚ÄôHearn | MLB Trade Rumors
The Pirates have made some interesting changes this offseason that should make them a more competitive team in 2026. They have been trying to find a left-handed slugger type for a while now, including offers to Josh Naylor and Kyle Schwarber. They will settle for the former Oriole O‚ÄôHearn instead, who enjoyed a career revival in Baltimore prior to a midseason trade to San Diego last year. Hopefully he crushes it in Pittsburgh for the next two years.

Mets Interested In Austin Hays | MLB Trade Rumors
The Mets are having a weird offseason. Cleaning the slate and going in a different direction makes sense. The team hasn‚Äôt been good enough. But some of the alternative paths they are taking don‚Äôt make a ton of sense if they goal is to win in 2026.

Questions linger as Orioles dive deeper into their offseason | Roch Kubatko
Roch recaps some of the Christmas Eve moves of Orioles past. Spoiler: not much has happened, so don‚Äôt expect it to change in 2025.

Is it your birthday? Happy birthday!

Miguel Castro turns 31 today. He spent parts of four seasons in the Orioles bullpen from 2017 through ‚Äò20. In that time he had a 4.06 ERA over 241.2 total innings.

Kevin Millwood turns 51. He played just the 2010 season in Baltimore, but he was named Opening Day starter that year and finished second on the team in innings with 190.2.

The late Chico Garc√≠a (b. 1924, d. 2007) was born on this day. A legend in his native Mexico, Garc√≠a played in just 39 MLB games, all of which came for the newly-arrived 1954 Orioles.

Christmas Eve has been a slow day in Orioles history, according to Baseball Reference. Maybe that changes today. Until then, here are a few things that have happened on the date beyond Birdland:

1814 ‚Äì Representatives of the United Kingdom and the United States sign the Treaty of Ghent, ending the War of 1812.

1818 ‚Äì The first performance of ‚ÄúSilent Night‚Äù takes place in Austria.

1826 ‚Äì The Eggnog Riot at the United States Military Academy begins at a drunken Christmas party in the North Barracks. It ends the next morning.

1906 ‚Äì The first radio broadcast is transmitted by Reginald Fessenden. It consists of a poetry reading, a violin solo, and a speech.

1973 ‚Äì The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is passed, allowing residents of Washington D.C. to elect their own local government.

title: 8 roster ties between Patriots, Jets ahead of Week 17
description: The ex-Patriots and ex-Jets in the fold for Sunday.
fullText:
Some things have changed since the New England Patriots faced the New York Jets in November. Most things, personnel-wise, have stayed the same.

Between the active rosters, practice squads and reserve lists, eight players currently in the fold have spent time with both AFC East clubs during their NFL careers.

Here‚Äôs a run through the familiar list ahead of Sunday‚Äôs 1 p.m. ET kickoff at MetLife Stadium.

Andrew Beck, fullback ‚Äî Signed by the Patriots as an undrafted free agent in 2019, Beck was waived at the NFL‚Äôs 53-man roster deadline following his rookie preseason. He would be claimed by the Denver Broncos from there and now stands 85 games and 24 starts into his run. The 29-year-old fullback by way of the Texas Longhorns has caught 30 passes for 252 yards and four touchdowns. Beck has also visited the end zone as a rusher. The league‚Äôs 2021 winner of the Salute to Service Award made stops with the Houston Texans and Green Back Packers before heading to East Rutherford last February.

Chukwuma Okorafor, offensive tackle ‚Äî Okorafor has appeared in 13 games on special teams for the Jets in 2025. The reserve tackle stayed in the division in March after being released from his one-year Patriots contract a month ahead of the new league year. Okorafor‚Äôs brief stay in Foxborough brought 12 offensive snaps as the starting left tackle during the 2024 season opener. Subsequently replaced, the 28-year-old out of Western Michigan landed on the left squad list and reverted to the reserves as his roster exemption expired. The Pittsburgh Steelers selected Okorafor in the third round of the 2018 draft at No. 92 overall, and he started 59 games in the AFC North.

Liam Fornadel, guard ‚Äî Fornadel signed with the Jets in training camp and is now in his second tour on the organization‚Äôs practice squad. The 26-year-old interior lineman joined the Patriots as a street free agent in 2024. He spent the majority of last campaign on the practice squad before being released with weeks remaining in the slate. Undrafted out of James Madison, Fornadel spent 2022 with the CFL‚Äôs Winnipeg Blue Bombers and has also been a member of the DC Defenders from the XFL and UFL, winning a championship last spring.

Ochaun Mathis, linebacker ‚Äî The Jets added Mathis to the practice squad midway through December. The 26-year-old linebacker stands 14 games, five tackles, one forced fumble and one quarterback hit into his career. Chosen in the sixth round of the 2023 NFL draft at No. 189 overall, Mathis logged his rookie campaign between the active roster and injured reserve of the Los Angeles Rams. He moved on to Gillette Stadium the following August. After three standard elevations, he climbed from the practice squad to the 53 from October into November. Subsequently waived, the former transfer from TCU to Nebraska caught on with the Philadelphia Eagles and earned a Super Bowl LIX ring as part of the practice squad. Mathis spent time this fall with the Cleveland Browns.

Nick Folk, kicker ‚Äî Folk finds himself 257 NFL games into a journey that got underway in the sixth round of the 2007 draft at No. 178 overall. The 41-year-old Arizona alum was named a Pro Bowler as a rookie. He went on be a Jet from 2010 through 2016. And now he is one again after working out and signing in July. The season has included a career-long field goal from 58 yards as well as a game-winning split of the uprights from 56 yards. Folk was part of the operation in Foxborough from 2019 through 2022, converting on 108-of-121 field goals and 116-of-127 extra points. AFC Special Teams Player of the Week was earned four times over that span, all while the veteran kicker tied for the league lead in scoring and set a league record for the most consecutive conversions from inside 50 yards. Folk‚Äôs Patriots stay ended via trade. He has also been with the Alliance of American Football as well as the Dallas Cowboys, Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Tennessee Titans.

Brandon Smith, wide receiver ‚Äî The Patriots signed Smith to the practice squad in advance of the divisional rematch. The 27-year-old wide receiver entered the NFL as an undrafted free agent out of Iowa in 2021. After parts of two seasons on the Dallas Cowboys‚Äô practice squad, he made multiple tours in the XFL with the DC Defenders. He then went from the Arizona Cardinals in 2023 to East Rutherford up into 2025. Three appearances followed as a standard elevation for the Jets, bringing the initial 22 snaps of his career between offense and special teams.

Morgan Moses, offensive tackle ‚Äî Across all 15 starts this fall, Moses has stayed in for 95.9 percent of the offensive snaps and returned last week from a knee injury that left him questionable. The 34-year-old right tackle signed with Patriots in March on a three-year pact. Entering the league out of Virginia in the third round of the 2014 draft at No. 66 overall, Moses has appeared in 181 games and started 173. The seasoned bookend has also been a member of the Washington Commanders and Baltimore Ravens. He‚Äôs twice called MetLife Stadium home, as well. First as a free agent in 2021 and then again in 2024 as a trade acquisition, Moses tallied 30 starts while among the front five for New York.

Leonard Taylor III, defensive tackle ‚Äî The Patriots signed Taylor to the practice squad in the midst of October after he cleared waivers via the Jets. He served as a standard elevation for the first time in December, notching five defensive snaps along with two tackles on quarterback Josh Allen. The 23-year-old defensive tackle entered the NFL with New York as an undrafted free agent in 2024. He made the 53-man roster and appeared in 16 games altogether, posting 27 tackles, 1.5 sacks and a pair of batted passes through 308 snaps on defense and 14 snaps on special teams.

title: Ospreys and Scarlets face festive date in Llanelli
description: Scarlets host Ospreys in the west Wales derby on 26 December in the United Rugby Championship (URC).
fullText:
There is a question swirling around the rugby public in west Wales during this Christmas period.

Will the December 2025 Welsh derby between Scarlets and Ospreys be the final one to be staged in Llanelli during the festive period?

There have not been many regular standout fixtures in the domestic Welsh calendar since the inception of regional rugby in 2003.

The double-header of Welsh derbies, normally staged the day after Christmas, has been one of those occasions.

Whether there will be another December derby between these two sides at Parc y Scarlets in two years remains to be seen.

This is because the future of Ospreys and Scarlets in their current guise is up in the air, leaving players, coaches and supporters heading into another uncertain Christmas for Welsh rugby.

The 26 December edition of this fixture might be the final one in Llanelli because of the Welsh Rugby Union's plans to cut a professional side.

Welsh rugby's governing body announced in October they want to reduce the amount of teams to three with licences to be granted in Cardiff, the west and east.

Negotiations have continued but WRU has announced that a decision on how a team will be cut will now not happen before the end of the year.

It seemed there would be a straight shootout between Scarlets and Ospreys for the west licence before another proposal has emerged.

That is Ospreys owners, Y11 Sports and Media, buying WRU-owned Cardiff and enabling Welsh rugby bosses to get to their magic number of three.

The WRU and Y11 have both declined to comment on this possibility, fuelling fears of Ospreys supporters about their sides' future, while Cardiff fans have been vocal on social media against any such proposed takeover deal.

Both coaches have reminded people of the significance of this fixture.

"It's an important game in the calendar for our fans," said Scarlets head coach Dwayne Peel.

"There is a lot of tradition behind it. Before Ospreys v Scarlets it was Llanelli v Swansea and Llanelli v Neath.

"With two teams being so close, it's great for rivalry and communities. From a rugby spectacle, it has provided some good games.

"It's always been a great time of the year and I have fond memories as a player and fan."

Peel's opposite number and former Scarlets team-mate Mark Jones agreed.

"It's the opportunity to go up against your closest rivals, both from a community perspective but also positional rivalry within Welsh rugby," said Jones.

"It brings that tribalism Welsh rugby is built on. That's the passion around the border rivalries.

"They [Scarlets] are our biggest rival, geographically and historically."

Jones is predicting Welsh rugby's latest perilous situation could provide some extra emotion.

"Looking at the landscape, I have no doubt that will be some sort of driver in sections of the media and supporters," said Jones.

"You need the emotion and desire but it's often around who controls that and who is the most accurate and disciplined. We are trying to get the balance right.

"If you are not up for this game, you have the wrong people in the room. I don't think that will be an issue."

Peel celebrates family wedding with win in Cardiff

Christmas cheers and jeers for Welsh sides

It will be a basement battle as Ospreys and Scarlets currently occupy the bottom two spots in the United Rugby Championships (URC).

Ospreys, who have only managed one league win in seven games, prop up the table with Scarlets one place above.

"It's never nice when you are down the bottom end, nobody wants to be there," said Jones.

"But when you look at how competitive the league is and what the difference is from ninth to 16th, it's a couple of wins and the whole world is different.

"It's early in the season and teams have had different runs of fixtures.

"I am not focused on where we are, I'm more interested in how we are playing and the accuracy of our game."

His sentiments were echoed by Peel, whose Scarlets' side have two league wins after losing the first four.

"I'm not overly concerned with league positions because I appreciate the start we had," said Peel.

"We will keep building and there's a lot of rugby to be played. If the performances are good enough, results look after themselves."

Scarlets are without injured Wales quartet Blair Murray, Sam Costelow, Josh Macleod and Kemsley Mathias.

Hooker Ryan Elias takes over the captaincy from Macleod who is replaced by the returning Taine Plumtree in one of four changes from the side that beat Cardiff.

Ellis Mee switches to full-back with Joe Roberts named on the wing, while props Alec Hepburn and Archer Holz start.

Ospreys are missing Wales prop Gareth Thomas but number eight Ross Moriarty starts after sitting out the 26-10 home defeat against Munster.

Wales squad places are also up for grabs with head coach Steve Tandy set to name his Six Nations squad for the tournament which starts with a trip to face England on 7 February.

"For internationals or young players coming through and trying to establish themselves, there is an opportunity to go up against a peer that is competing for the same position," said Jones.

Scarlets: Mee; Rogers, James, J Williams, Roberts; Hawkins; G Davies; Hepburn, Elias (capt), Holz, Lousi, Ball, Douglas, Plumtree, Anderson.

Replacements: van der Merwe, Morse, H Thomas, T Davies, Taylor, Hughes, E Price, Page.

Ospreys: Walsh; Conbeer, Watkin, K Williams, Giles; Edwards, Hardy; S Thomas, Lake (capt), Henry, Sutton, R Smith, Ratti, Deaves, Moriarty.

Replacements: Parry, G Phillips, Botha, R Davies, Morris, L Davies, Cokanasiga, Hopkins.

Assistant referees: Craig Evans (WRU), Carwyn Sion (WRU)

title: Is former Boston Celtics guard Ray Allen one of the greatest shooters of all time?
description: Klay Thompson seems to think so.
fullText:
Is former Boston Celtics shooting guard Ray Allen one of the greatest shooters of all time? The former University of Connecticut star is widely known as having one of the best forms for shooting from beyond the arc, and held the record for the most 3-point shots made in NBA history until he saw his record broken by Golden State Warriors legend Steph Curry.

But if you ask former Dubs sharpshooter in his own right, Klay Thompson, Curry's teammate for most of his career, whether he thinks Jesus Shuttlesworth (a nickname of Allen's from a role he played in the film 'He Got Game') should be counted among the game's greatest long-distance marksmen, you will get an emphatic yes from the Dallas Mavericks vet.

The folks behind the "CLNS Media Boston Sports Network" YouTube channel put together a clip from their "Showtime with Coop" podcast featuring Thompson, and that topic of course came up. Check it out below to hear what they said about where Allen ought to be ranked among the best shooters in history.

Listen to "Havlicek Stole the Pod" on:

title: Real Madrid superstar duo compared to ex-Barcelona greats ‚Äì ‚ÄòTwo players who don‚Äôt understand each other‚Ä¶‚Äô
description: Real Madrid are going through a difficult period now, with uncertainty ranging from Xabi Alonso‚Äôs future to a lack of cohesion among attackers.The dynamics between Kylian Mbappe and Vinicius Jr. hav...
fullText:
Real Madrid are going through a difficult period now, with uncertainty ranging from Xabi Alonso‚Äôs future to a lack of cohesion among attackers.

The dynamics between Kylian Mbappe and Vinicius Jr. have been particularly worrying, as the two have not been able to gel together as well as one would have hoped.

While Mbappe has carried the team with goals, Vinicius looks like a shadow of his former self, leading to Santi Canizares stating that the terms being demanded by him from Real Madrid in the renewal deal are far more than what the player is producing right now.

Keeping in mind the imbalanced power dynamic between Mbappe and Vinicius, Jose Mario Bakero has compared the situation to Barcelona in the 90s.

The former Bar√ßa player particularly compared the situation to the dynamics that unfolded between Hristo Stoichkov and Romario.

‚ÄúThis happened to us a little, although not in the same way or with the same characteristics,‚Äù he told El Larguero (h/t Mundo Deportivo).

Is the power imbalance growing at Real Madrid? (Photo by Angel Martinez/Getty Images)

Bakero explained how Barcelona used to be a stable unit, before Romero‚Äôs arrival threw them off balance.

‚ÄúWhen it was just Stoichkov, accompanied by Koeman and Laudrup, we had three pillars, and everything was more or less fine.

‚ÄúBut, from the moment Romario arrived, two players with a personality that stood out above the rest of the group came in. It threw us off balance,‚Äù he revealed.

Finally, Bakero warned that it is a dangerous game to have two defining egos in the same team and how it can disrupt a well-functioning team.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs unbalancing everyone, and especially themselves. In our case, Stoichkov and Romario lost many of the qualities they had.

‚ÄúSo, what‚Äôs the problem? When you have two players who don‚Äôt understand each other‚Äôs roles, it becomes incredibly complicated,‚Äù he concluded.

title: Kyle Long on Travis Kelce's future after Patrick Mahomes' injury
description: During his chat with @EdEastonJr, retired All-Pro Kyle Long discussed Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce's future after Patrick Mahomes' injury
fullText:
This week, Chiefs Wire's Ed Easton Jr. spoke with retired All-Pro offensive lineman and CBS Sports analyst Kyle Long.

In his interview with Easton Jr., Long discussed his role as a remote analyst for NFL Christmas Gameday on Netflix on Thursday, December 25th, and his thoughts on Travis Kelce potentially retiring after Patrick Mahomes' devastating knee injury.

On Christmas Day, Emmy and Grammy Award‚Äìwinning superstar Kelly Clarkson will welcome fans with a performance of her holiday hit, "Underneath the Tree." Snoop's Holiday Halftime Party features special guest Lainey Wilson and stars from KPOP Demon Hunters.

NFL CHRISTMAS GAMEDAY
LIVE on Netflix December 25
-- 
Cowboys vs. Commanders @ 1 PM ET
Lions vs. Vikings @ 4:30 PM ET

‚Äî Netflix Sports (@netflixsports) December 18, 2025

Mahomes' Week 15 season-ending injury requiring surgery to repair his ACL and LCL won't likely have him back immediately for the start of the 2026 season. Long shared his thoughts on this, which could affect Kelce's future playing.

"Well, there was a book I read when I was younger. It's called 'Where the Red Fern Grows'. It was about, I don't really know what it was about, but there were two dogs in it, and they were so dang close," said Long, "They did everything together, they hunted together, they ate together, they slept together. And once, one of the dogs got hurt on a barbed-wire fence. The dog didn't make it. It's one of the saddest stories I've ever read, and then the other dog couldn't eat anymore. It was sad."

Mahomes and Kelce have been one of the league's greatest duos since the 2018 season. The prospect of them returning to form with a healthy Mahomes is a sight many Chiefs fans would love to see after a disappointing 2025 season.

"Is that what happens in Kansas City," said Long, "or are we going to see Travis Kelce, like he did this past offseason, train his butt off, come in the best shape of his life, be a top-five producing tight end in football, and wait for his homeboy (Patrick Mahomes) to show back up at quarterback? They can take some names and kick some butts, because people are taking their shots on the Kansas City Chiefs right now."

This article originally appeared on Chiefs Wire: Kyle Long on Travis Kelce's future after Patrick Mahomes' injury

title: The Tank Bowl: Will anyone watch New York Giants vs. Las Vegas Raiders?
description: The New York Giants will take on the Las Vegas Raiders in The Tank Bowl on Sunday, but will anyone be watching with a better alternative?
fullText:
Since the NFL has three games scheduled for Christmas Day on Thursday and two on Saturday, the main slate on Sunday is quite bare -- just nine games are scheduled. The early 1:00 pm window gets the lion's share of those games (seven), leaving just two for the late window.

The two games in the late window could not be more opposed in importance.

The 4:05 game on CBS is a matchup between the league's two worst teams -- the New York Giants and the Las Vegas Raiders -- who both enter Week 17 with 2-13 records, scrambling for the right to secure the No. 1 overall pick in the 2026 NFL draft.

Kevin Harlan getting Raiders-Giants means the number 1 pick is going to be decided by an incredible play at the end of the game that we will all remember for years https://t.co/Mf99zBppAX

‚Äî Clem (@TheClemReport) December 23, 2025

Some prognosticators are calling this game the Tank Bowl. Bottom line: The loser is the real winner in this one.

The second game, at 4:25 on FOX, features the defending Super Bowl champion Philadelphia Eagles traveling to Buffalo to take on the Bills and Josh Allen.

Now, how many people do you think will be turning the channel at 4:25 from CBS to FOX? We're guessing a whole lot. These two teams could find themselves in the Super Bowl this February.

The Giants are on a nine-game losing streak and have lost 13 consecutive road games going back to last season. The Raiders are also on a nine-game skid. They are just 1-6 at home this year.

No matter where one turns on late Sunday afternoon, Tom Brady will have some influence and interest. He is a minority owner of the Raiders, and he will be serving as the booth analyst for the Bills-Eagles game.

This article originally appeared on Giants Wire: The Tank Bowl: Will anyone watch New York Giants vs. Las Vegas Raiders?

title: ASU football coach Kenny Dillingham building program differently
description: College football has never been more transactional than it is right now. That‚Äôs what makes the culture that Kenny Dillingham has created stand out.
fullText:
College football has never been more transactional than it is right now.

With players allowed to make money through Name, Image and Likeness deals and a transfer portal that currently features 852 athletes, the sport is truly in a new day and age. Private equity is starting to get involved, adding to the corporate feel that is growing.

That‚Äôs what makes the culture that Arizona State football coach Kenny Dillingham has created in Tempe stand out. Yes, Dillingham might be the most easy-going coach in college football when it comes to the transfer portal. Not many other coaches will wish you good luck and promote your transfer on social media.

But that doesn‚Äôt mean ASU is just a bus stop and hoping to reload with transfer portal players every season. There‚Äôs a sense of real connection within the building.

Sophomore linebacker Martell Hughes was recruited from high school in San Diego as part of the second class signed under Dillingham. Hughes said he was drawn in specifically because of Dillingham.

‚ÄúThe culture that coach Kenny had defined, that he wanted to bring, especially with all the new guys he brought in with the portal,‚Äù Hughes said. ‚ÄúThe plan he had built for this and the city of Tempe. Just believing in him and the coaching staff is what ultimately brought me here.‚Äù

The word is used throughout the world of sports, yet there is no one singular definition. It‚Äôs different everywhere.

‚ÄúBeing a family, being passionate, having the love and want to do this and day in and day out,‚Äù Hughes said. ‚ÄúHe talks about it every day. Football is hard, and it‚Äôs a violent game, but if you don‚Äôt love it, there‚Äôs no point in doing it. His passion and love for his guys on the team, staff, it just runs through everybody. It‚Äôs infectious.‚Äù

Or, as Dillingham has made the motto of the team: ‚ÄúHave more fun while working harder than anybody in the country.‚Äù

The phrase is blasted all over the team‚Äôs walls and has been repeated countless times by Dillingham and his players. Now, it has come to personify the nature of these Sun Devils.

It‚Äôs one of the reasons why Hughes has stayed in Tempe, instead of entering the portal and trying to get more playing time elsewhere.

‚ÄúComing out of high school, they took the chance on me,‚Äù Hughes said. ‚ÄúThey mapped out a plan for me and for this program. Believing in them. Why would I jump ship when they put their all into me?‚Äù

That belief is on track to pay off as Hughes, after learning and developing from Keyshaun Elliott and Jordan Crook the past two seasons, appears ready to move up the depth chart entering 2026. Hughes had the game-sealing interception in the win against TCU.

Even for players who have spent time in other locker rooms, like graduate student and offensive lineman Ben Coleman, the culture at ASU is distinctive.

Coleman played 25 games at the University of California and earned his bachelor's and master's there before transferring to Tempe. He played the last two seasons for Arizona State after receiving an extra year of eligibility.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs different here,‚Äù Coleman said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very personal the way they challenge us, in the weight room, on the football field. The way they will us to compete in everything we do. Doesn‚Äôt matter if it‚Äôs Madden, (NBA) 2K, bringing a hoop out here, playing knockout. Everything is competing. That‚Äôs why we have a basketball hoop in the football team room, for that exact reason.‚Äù

The competition never ends. The team tracks what every player does and compiles it. It's referred to as ‚ÄúSkittles Wars.‚Äù From breakfast check-in to study hall and reps in the weight room, nothing goes unnoticed. At the end of the season, a winner is declared.

‚ÄúYou wake up, and the first thing you do before you even open a notebook is, ‚ÄòHey man. Let‚Äôs compete right now,‚Äô‚Äù Coleman said. ‚ÄúIf you can‚Äôt compete, he doesn‚Äôt want anybody there who doesn‚Äôt want to compete.‚Äù

Like Coleman, defensive lineman Justin Wodtly spent time in other locker rooms, playing at Cincinnati before transferring ahead of the 2024 season. Some of those locker rooms were strictly football, nothing else.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve had three head coaches,‚Äù Wodtly said. ‚ÄúHere, it shows how much Coach Dillingham really cares about the team, how much he cares about building relationships, how much he cares about your life outside of football. Doing all those things is a testament to who he is as a person.‚Äù

Perhaps the person who most embodies ‚Äî literally ‚Äî the culture that has been created at Arizona State is Wodtly.

Only 18 months passed before Wodtly decided to make ASU part of his body, getting a sprawling tattoo on his right calf with Sparky‚Äôs pitchfork as the centerpiece, set in front of a desert landscape with saguaros, mountains and lightning in the sky.

And more could be on the way in the future.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a huge part of me, who I am,‚Äù Wodtly said. ‚ÄúI appreciate this university. I‚Äôm very grateful for the time I got to spend here. I might have to add to it soon.‚Äù

Logan Stanley is a sports reporter with The Arizona Republic who primarily focuses on high school, college and Olympic sports. To suggest ideas for human-interest stories and other news, reach out to Stanley at logan.stanley@usatodayco.com or 707-293-7650. Follow him on X, formerly Twitter: @LSscribe.

This article originally appeared on Arizona Republic: Arizona State building culture of family trust under Kenny Dillingham

title: Fans lose it over Charles Leclerc's F1 secret santa gift to George Russell: "Master ragebait"
description: Charles Leclerc has amused Formula 1 fans by gifting George Russell a framed and looping video of their controversial 2025 Dutch Grand Prix overtake
fullText:
Formula 1 fans have been losing it over Charles Leclerc's gift to George Russell for the championship's Secret Santa.

The Monegasque driver decided to frame a photo of his overtake of Russell at the 2025 Dutch Grand Prix, which was a point of contention for the British driver. As the Ferrari driver attacked Russell on the outside of Turn 11 at a safety car restart during the race at Zandvoort, he appeared to leave the track on the outside of Turn 12 before rejoining ahead of Russell.

"He was off the track, surely?" Russell said over team radio as Leclerc said to his team: "Turn 11, 12, he doesn‚Äôt leave a space. He cannot complain."

The stewards investigated the move, and both drivers were summoned after the race. The stewards later noted that "both drivers felt that this was a racing incident and that there should be no further consequence to either driver for the incident", which they agreed with.

"Naughty, naughty, naughty," Russell said with a smile as he pulled back the bubble wrap to reveal the photo. "Let's see part two, shall we?" he added as he uncovered the electric photo frame showing a slow-motion version of the overtake.

"Oh, look at that! That is so kind of him," he added, with a hint of sarcasm, before adding: "He can overtake illegally, so that's all he's got in the locker. Bashing people off the track. I'm lost for words actually, I'm lost for words."

Charles Leclerc knew what to get George Russell for Christmas immediately after picking him in Secret Santa üòÖ pic.twitter.com/Jo0H9oE9sB

‚Äî Autosport (@autosport) December 24, 2025

The moment between Leclerc and Russell quickly became a hot topic in the comments with reactions from fans flooding in. "Charles well and truly understood the assignment. He has been on a mission to ragebait Russell all year," one wrote, while another added: "Charles' gift is wild."

"Leclerc with the master ragebait," someone else commented, with another adding: "George was livid, that‚Äôs peak British anger."

"Charles pulling Russell's leg and getting him very angry was the best gift," wrote another fan.

Another added: "Charles has a diabolical sense of humour."

To read more Motorsport.com articles visit our website.

title: Ohio State vs. Miami Cotton Bowl Classic preview and prediction
description: Ohio State begins its quest for a repeat national championship in the Cotton Bowl against the Miami Hurricanes.
fullText:
Some time has passed since Ohio State found itself on the wrong side of the scoreboard in the Big Ten Championship game. As much as that loss stung, of the three goals the football team has, a conference championship is the one fans can live without.

The Buckeyes have moved on to the College Football Playoff and a matchup with the Miami Hurricanes. Miami moved on after an opening-round win over Texas A&M by a score of 10-3. The reward? A date with No. 2 Ohio State in the Goodyear Cotton Bowl Classic.

Of course, the Hurricanes and Buckeyes have a history in games that mean something. Miami fans have been crying foul for 20-plus years after a pass interference call allowed Ohio State to win its first National Championship since 1968. Buckeye fans will tell you it was the right call... and it was.

The U wants revenge. Ohio State wants back-to-back titles. It's the Buckeyes vs. the 'Canes‚Äîtime to get ready for the College Football Playoff Quarterfinals.

The stage is set üó£Ô∏è

No. 2 Buckeyes üÜö No. 10 Hurricanes in the Cotton Bowl üèüÔ∏è

üîó https://t.co/iWlQmFbLBo pic.twitter.com/aGJQfnyI7A

‚Äî Ohio State Buckeyes üå∞ (@OhioStAthletics) December 20, 2025

Ohio State (12-1), Miami (11-2)

Venue:¬†AT&T Stadium (Arlington, Texas), Capacity: 80,000

All-Time Series:¬†Series tied at 2

Last Meeting:¬†Miami defeated Ohio State 24-6 in 2011

The Ohio State football team finds itself in familiar territory. The Buckeyes are back in the College Football Playoff once again, this time looking to repeat as National Champions. Standing in the way... The Miami Hurricanes. While Miami may have two losses on the season, this is a team loaded with talent. Several players who now reside in South Florida were originally committed to OSU, including running back Mark Fletcher and defensive lineman Justin Scott.

This will be the second game in a row where Ohio State will face a top-tier defense, most notably on the defensive line. Both Akheem Mesidor and Rueben Bain Jr. are a menace to opposing backfields. The duo has combined for 16 sacks and five forced fumbles. The Buckeye offensive line will need to protect Julian Sayin better than they did against Indiana in the Big Ten Championship game. In that game, Sayin was sacked five times, which was nearly as many as the 12 previous games combined.

The Hurricanes love to pressure opposing quarterbacks. On the season, Miami has 41 sacks on the season, seven of which came against Texas A&M in the CFP first round. Rueben Bain got to Marcell Reed three times all by himself. Ohio State has the best skill players in the country, but it's hard to get the ball to playmakers from your backside.

There are ways to neutralize a strong pass rush by dialing up screen passes, quick slants, and draw plays. Ryan Day has said he will be taking over playcalling duties, so we can expect to see some more creativity to counterattack the aggressive style of Miami. If not, it'll be a long day for the Buckeye offense.

Defensively, Ohio State is still a force to be reckoned with. The Hurricanes do have excellent players at the skill positions, but the team seems to lose focus from time to time. Especially quarterback Carson Beck. The Georgia transfer has thrown for over 3,000 yards and 26 touchdowns, but he's also thrown 10 interceptions.

Pressure on Beck is a must. When Beck has been made to feel uncomfortable in the pocket, he is much more prone to mistakes. According to Pro Football Focus, when Beck is pressured, he is the No. 112-ranked quarterback in the nation. When he is not blitzed and allowed to sit in a clean pocket, he is the No. 18-ranked quarterback. Simply put, Beck can carve up a defense if he has time to survey the field, but speed him up and he is much more likely to make mistakes.

Mario Cristobal will look for ways to get the ball in the hands of his dynamic freshman, Malachi Toney. The youngster leads Miami with 89 receptions, nearly 1,000 yards, and eight touchdowns. But again, pressure Beck and he'll have a hard time getting Toney the ball.

The bottom line is that both defenses are spectacular. It's a tale as old as time: whoever can win the line of scrimmage will win the game.

Phillip Daniels - Offensive Line

We really could put the entire offensive line here, but we decided to go with just one. After being a solid contributor at right tackle all season long, Phillip Daniels struggled against the Indiana pass rush in the Big Ten Championship game. Part of that may have been that the Hoosiers have smaller, quicker edge rushers. Daniels has the opportunity to redeem himself and will need to allow Julian Saying time to throw the ball, or the Buckeyes will be in a world of hurt.

As we stated earlier, Carson Beck is prone to making mistakes when under pressure. Caden Curry has been a sack master this season, getting to opposing quarterbacks 11 times. Miami has been good at protecting Beck, giving up only 11 sacks the entire season. Curry doesn't need to get a sack on every play, but provide enough pressure to keep Beck on his heels. If he can do that, the defense should be able to hold the Hurricane offense in check.

At first glance, this game seems to favor the Scarlet and Gray somewhat heavily. On paper, OSU looks like the superior team, but that wouldn't be the full story. Both Miami and Ohio State boast two of the best defenses in the country. Both teams are littered with NFL talent. Both teams have electric playmakers on offense. So what will this game come down to?

The game will most likely be a slog, much like the Buckeyes' game against Indiana in the Big Ten Championship. And in a game of this magnitude, it is true once again, whoever can win in the trenches will come out on top when the clock strikes zero. In a game where both teams are somewhat evenly matched, Ohio State has a slight advantage on both sides of the ball. While the Miami defense may be able to hold the Buckeye offense in check for most of the night, the skill positions are just too good, especially with a laser-focused Ryan Day taking over the play-calling duties. It's close going into halftime, but Ohio State pulls away in the second half to advance to the College Football Playoff Semifinals.

Final score prediction | Ohio State 24, Miami 13

Contact/Follow us¬†@BuckeyesWire¬†on X (formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of Ohio State news and opinion.

This article originally appeared on Buckeyes Wire: Ohio State football Cotton Bowl preview and prediction vs. Miami

title: Arizona Cardinals mock draft. Predictions for first 10 picks
description: The Arizona Cardinals need a quarterback this offseason. The question is whether they'll be able to find one in the first round of the NFL draft.
fullText:
How have we gotten here? This Arizona Cardinals‚Äô season was supposed to lead to the playoffs. At the very least, it was supposed to lead to contention. Christmas week should have been about setting the stage for a heavyweight showdown with the Cincinnati Bengals.

Instead, the Bengals are 5-10 and the Cardinals are somehow even worse, at 3-12.

So now, that familiar time of year has arrived, far earlier than anyone had hoped. It‚Äôs mock draft season.

This year‚Äôs draft class is widely considered to be a thin group, but that‚Äôs OK for the Cardinals. They currently hold the No. 6 pick. The big question, though, is where they‚Äôll be able to find their quarterback of the future.

So for the first time, here are our top 10 projected picks of the 2026 NFL Draft. As always, this mock draft is without trades.

If the Giants do ultimately end up with the No. 1 pick, a trade becomes highly likely. New York already has a promising young quarterback, Jaxson Dart, while the rest of the top 10 is packed with quarterback-needy teams ‚Äî including the Cardinals, of course.

Would Arizona pony up the package required for the top selection? That‚Äôs a question for general manager Monti Ossenfort and, potentially, head coach Jonathan Gannon, if he retains his job. But it might be the best path to a quarterback, given the teams currently ahead of them.

If the Giants beat the Raiders this week, though, Las Vegas will jump into the No. 1 spot. Unlike the Giants, the Raiders desperately need quarterback help and would not likely trade the pick.

As for Reese, he could be the top non-quarterback off the board, as a versatile, explosive player who can line up off the edge or at linebacker. It‚Äôs just unlikely it will actually be at the No. 1 pick after trades.

Mendoza, this year‚Äôs Heisman Trophy winner, is noted for his elite football intelligence and ability to play on-time within an offense. If this Cardinals‚Äô coaching staff remains in place, that will be an appealing proposition, given that they preferred Jacoby Brissett to Kyler Murray for those reasons. The problem will be getting a high enough draft pick to secure Mendoza, who is the betting favorite for the top pick.

Some expect Moore to remain in school, as he has made just 18 career starts and could earn a nice NIL payday if he returned to Oregon. But as his draft stock climbs, so too do his chances of declaring. That would be a major boost for the Cardinals, who need as many quarterbacks as possible in this class to help their chances of finding one. On the field, Moore stands out with his accuracy and creativity as a passer.

As has been the case for most of the past five decades, the Jets need a quarterback this spring. But if they end up behind the Raiders and Browns, that might require a trade up. Fortunately for New York, they have five first-round picks over the next two years ‚Äî ammunition that the Cardinals can‚Äôt match.

As for Bain, he‚Äôs a powerful edge rusher who just notched three sacks against Texas A&M in the College Football Playoff. He could be the first defensive player off the board.

Unlike the quarterback-needy teams around them, the Titans are in a great spot. Their top offseason priority will be finding talent to help support Cam Ward. And no matter where they end up, they should be able to draft either Tate or Jordyn Tyson, the top two wide receivers.

So, this is the Cardinals‚Äô conundrum. Only two quarterbacks are currently seen as top-five picks, and one of them might stay in college.

Trading up would be expensive, especially for a team that has holes all over its roster. Ty Simpson ‚Äî the potential third quarterback off the board ‚Äî would be a reach. There are few good options, unless their pick moves up over the next two weeks.

All of that could leave the Cardinals looking to another position. That‚Äôs where Fano comes in. He‚Äôs an athletic player who is widely considered the top tackle in the class. Pairing him with Paris Johnson Jr. would give the Cardinals their tackle duo of the future and boost an offensive line that has struggled in 2025.

Purely from a talent perspective, Love might be the best player in this class. But as with Ashton Jeanty last year, the issue is positional value. Washington would be passing up on much-needed defensive help to draft Love.

Still, the idea is tantalizing: a hyper-talented running back to pair with Jayden Daniels. That would give Washington one of the league‚Äôs most dangerous rushing attacks and reduce the need for Daniels to play hero ball, potentially helping him stay healthier.

Tyler Shough has been a pleasant late-season surprise, removing the Saints from the list of teams that need quarterback help. Drafting Tyson to pair with Chris Olave would suddenly create the potential for an exciting offense in New Orleans.

While a homecoming with Tyson might be enticing for local fans ‚Äî especially after missing out on Cam Skattebo last year ‚Äî the fit doesn‚Äôt make much sense for the Cardinals. Wide receiver is one of their few positions of strength.

In many ways, Downs is the Jeremiyah Love of the defensive side ‚Äî an elite talent at a non-premium position. The Bengals, though, need all the help they can get on defense, no matter where it comes. Downs would be a nice fit.

Simpson is the wild card of this quarterback class. He could return to college, with only one year of starting experience under his belt. He could also slip to the back of the first round, due to both his lack of his experience and his struggles late in the season. Or teams could be wooed by his processing ability and early-season tape, shooting him up draft boards. All three options are on the table for now.

This article originally appeared on Arizona Republic: Early Arizona Cardinals 2026 NFL mock draft

title: Noah Maniscalco, Matuta Msafiri headline top boys basketball performers
description: The De Pere boys basketball team extended its winning streak in the Fox River Classic to 61 after huge victories over Sheboygan North and Bay Port.
fullText:
The four-time defending Fox River Classic Conference champions showed the road to the league title still goes through De Pere after an 86-65 win over Sheboygan North and an even more dominating 80-52 victory against Bay Port.

Both were ranked in the top 10 in Division 1 entering last week.

The Redbirds have won 61 consecutive conference games.

The Thunder beat New London by 19 points and Green Bay West by 50 to remain perfect.

That game against De Pere did not go well. The Pirates will attempt to get some revenge when they host the Redbirds in a rematch Feb. 6.

The Phantoms joined crosstown rival De Pere as the only remaining undefeated teams in FRCC play entering the week.

The Storm went to overtime to beat Peshtigo 61-57 after defeating its previous three opponents by an average of 36.7 points.

The Vikings slipped to 2-2 in North Eastern Conference play after a loss to Little Chute, although they rebounded with a win over a Luxemburg-Casco squad that entered on a three-game winning streak.

The Wolverines won their fifth straight game with a 73-47 victory at Coleman.

They are the only squad left in the nine-team Marinette & Oconto Conference without a loss in league play, starting 4-0. Crivitz is ahead of a trio of 2-1 teams in Gillett, Oneida Nation and Suring.

Suffered the one-point loss to West De Pere after almost coming back from a 13-point halftime deficit. The Tritons responded three days later with a 77-62 win at Manitowoc.

They still have not played a game at home this season and won‚Äôt until hosting Ashwaubenon on Jan 2.

After getting crushed by 33 points in an FRCC opener against West De Pere earlier this month, the Red Raiders responded with double figure wins over Green Bay Preble and Ashwaubenon last week.

The Wolves are a half-game behind Kewaunee for the top spot in the Packerland. The teams meet for the first time Jan. 20.

VOTE NOW: Choose the Cellcom Press-Gazette high school athlete of the week

The junior had 15 points and 10 rebounds against Two Rivers, 11 points and 9 rebounds against Little Chute and 11 points and 11 rebounds against Luxemburg-Casco in a 2-1 week for the Vikings.

The senior had 21 points, 10 rebounds, 5 assists and 2 steals in a 60-49 win over Southern Door, helping keep the Wolves a half-game behind Kewaunee for the top spot in the Packerland.

The sophomore had 15 rebounds, 3 assists and 2 blocks in a 57-51 win over Niagara to help the Thunderhawks improve to 3-1.

The senior guard had to wait his turn while either behind veterans or recovering from injury, but he‚Äôs the newest star at De Pere.

He had 25 points, 7 rebounds, 5 assists and shot 7-for-11 against Sheboygan North and had 18 points, 10 rebounds and shot 7-for-10 against Bay Port.

Maniscalco leads the FRCC with 23 points a contest and is fourth in shooting at 63.8%.

The Wildcats have struggled in a winless start after seven games, but their senior guard-forward has been a bright spot.

His latest highlight came in a loss to Menominee Nation when he scored 42 points and had 21 rebounds. He ranks 10th in the Bay Conference in scoring with 19 points per game and second with 9.9 rebounds.

The senior guard led the Red Devils to their first Bay win in three seasons with an 89-75 win over Menasha.

He scored 38 points on 13-for-22 shooting and added 9 rebounds. Msafiri is averaging a team-high 19.5 points.

Helped the Red Raiders go 2-0. The junior scored a game-high 22 points in a 67-44 win over Preble and a game-high 25 points in a 76-57 win over Ashwaubenon.

Scored a game-high 25 points, had 9 rebounds and 3 assists and shot 9-for-13 in 34 minutes in a 66-65 win over Notre Dame.

The junior guard is averaging a team-high 15 points this season.

The senior guard had 26 points, 4 steals and shot 10-for-14 against Southwest and added 8 points and 4 rebounds against De Pere.

Ivy leads the Pirates in scoring with 18.4 points per game, which ranks sixth in the FRCC.

title: Ranking all 5 NBA Christmas 2025 games from 'meh' to ignore your family
description: The NBA's Christmas Day schedule is STACKED this year. Here's how you should prioritize watching each game.
fullText:
There are few more delightful American traditions than the NBA's marquee Christmas Day slate. With no due respect to the brazen, oversaturated NFL ‚Äî which has an abysmal Christmas schedule ‚Äî the 25th of December will always belong to the Association and its biggest stars and best teams. It's just that much more special.

Well, to be clear, Christmas with the NBA is actually special, for one.

This year, it sure seems like we're in for some Christmas barnburners. A three-time MVP takes on one of the NBA's bright, young superstars in the latest chapter of a wonderful rivalry in Denver. Two legends reunite with a holiday background in the Bay Area. Another MVP squares off against the possible future of the sport in Oklahoma City. Two star-laden teams try to see who's more worthy of the hype in Southern California. And a potential elite shotmaking battle could be in store at Madison Square Garden.

But not all of these matchups were created equal. Let's rank all five NBA Christmas games this year and determine which ones are worth at least slightly paying attention to, which ones are worth ignoring your family, and which ones you can probably ignore entirely. Note: All games will be available to watch on ESPN and ABC.

Is it real hoops? Unfortunately, no.

I get the intrigue of watching former longtime teammates, Steph Curry and Klay Thompson, pitted against one another. I also think that a potential generational rookie like Cooper Flagg deserves the big Christmas stage. He'll make the most of it. But when we boil this game down, it features two of the Western Conference's more middling teams. It might be fun for a little while, like at the very start, but otherwise, expect some pretty forgettable basketball here. I don't think it's worth your time on a holiday.

Is it real hoops? Uh ... maybe.

Before the season, the Cavaliers and Knicks looked like the clear top two teams in the East. A matchup in the Eastern Conference Finals seemed inevitable. The Knicks have held up their end of the bargain. The Cavaliers, who have already almost lost as many games this year as they did during all of last season's regular season, have not.

With that said, Donovan Mitchell and Jalen Brunson could make for some electric shotmaking in the clutch on both ends. This one is at least worth keeping on in the background at home to monitor.

Is it real hoops? Yes, let's roll with it.

When all is said and done, I think Alperen ≈ûeng√ºn's and Kevin Durant's Rockets have a markedly higher ceiling as a legit NBA title contender. But it's hard to deny the Lakers' sheer star power, with Luka Donƒçiƒá, Austin Reaves, and LeBron James. I don't think the Lakers can hang with the Rockets in a seven-game playoff series. I do, however, think they can push them in a potential Christmas classic that features so much talent on both ends of the floor.

Is it real hoops? Oh goodness, YES. Absolutely, YES.

With two heated playoff meetings and seemingly countless down-to-the-wire regular-season meetings over the last three years, the Nuggets and Timberwolves have a legit case as the NBA's best active rivalry. It is, more often than not, what elite basketball should be all about. There is nothing like watching Nikola Jokiƒá and Anthony Edwards trade shot after shot in a physical game between two squads who hate and respect each other so much at the same time.

This rivalry game concludes the NBA's Christmas Day slate this year. It will likely be the perfect dessert.

Is it real hoops? Dearest readers, YES.

I don't think the Thunder and Spurs have enough established history to consider them a real rivalry yet, but hoo boy, are they getting there. Victor Wembanyama has already made his displeasure with the Thunder well-known. Plus, his Spurs are one of the few teams to actually knock off juggernaut Oklahoma City so far this season. Expect a well-coached and disciplined game from both teams. Expect a few trademark, ridiculous sequences courtesy of Wembanyama, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, and others.

And expect a worthy early entry to what will likely eventually become the NBA's best rivalry down the line.

This article originally appeared on For The Win: Best NBA Christmas 2025 games to watch this year, ranked

title: Series history: Penn State, Clemson to meet for second time
description: Penn State and Clemson have met just one time in their programs' history, a 1985 matchup in the Citrus Bowl
fullText:
Penn State and Clemson will meet for the second time ever on Saturday in the Pinstripe Bowl. The Tigers hold the series record with a 1-0 advantage after a dominant victory in the 1988 Citrus Bowl.

The teams met on New Year's Day in 1988, marking the first and only meeting. Clemson came out victorious, 35-10, in a dominant showing in Orlando, Florida.

Penn State was led by quarterback Matt Knizner, who went 13-of-22 for 158 yards and one touchdown. He also threw two interceptions, as well.

Leroy Thompson was the team's leading rusher, taking six carries for 55 yards. Receiving-wise, Michael Timpson caught four of Knizner's 13 completions for 81 yards. The Nittany Lions were without key offensive weapon Blair Thomas. The rushing and receiving threat missed the game due to a knee sprain. Thomas was the leading rusher on the team during the 1987 season with 1414 yards and 11 touchdowns, averaging 128.5 yards per game.

Without Thomas, the Nittany Lions' rushing attack took a significant drop, with the team running under Thomas's average mark, only earning 111 yards.

On Clemson's side, it was Rodney Williams behind the center. Williams earned the Citrus Bowl MVP, completing 15-of-24 passes for 214 yards. The Tigers had a balanced attack, running for 285 yards, as well.

Terry Allen was the lead back, running 11 times for 105 yards and a touchdown. The Tigers scored all five of their touchdowns on the run game.

With both teams missing a multitude of their players, and Penn State once again missing at least one of its lead rushers, the 2025 edition of this series should be considerably closer.

This article originally appeared on Nittany Lions Wire: Series history: Penn State, Clemson to meet for second time

fullText:
Clemson football arrived in New York on Tuesday for its matchup against Penn State in the 2025 Pinstripe Bowl.

The Tigers (7-5) and Nittany Lions (6-6) are meeting for just the second time in history. Clemson is also playing at Yankee Stadium for the first time in its history. The Pinstripe Bowl began in 2010 and for the past 11 years, it has pitted the ACC against the Big Ten.

In that span, the game has decidedly swung in one conference's favor: the Big Ten's representative has won all but one of the previous 10 matchups against the ACC's representative in New York. The Big Ten has also won eight straight Pinstripe Bowl matchups.

Kickoff for Clemson-Penn State in the 15th annual Pinstripe Bowl is noon ET. The game will be televised nationally on ABC.
